page.title: 19Homelife
page.content: A Day in the life of Matthew Ellis.Age 9.I wake up and go downstairs.I know what we are having for breakfast because we have the same thing every morning.We have marmalade on toast and cornflakes,and Ribena to drink.By this time it is 25 to 9 so I decide to see what is on television.Most times cartoons are on.Sometimes we play on bikes and sometimes we play football so we play football. For dinner I have cheese on cream crackers.In the afternoon I go to Bradford to get a record.I go to Virgin Records.When I come home I listen to the final score.I also watch television or the video. At school we watch a T.V programme about Denmark.We go to the swimming baths.Back at school we do maths.We have topic time and after play,drawing or weaving.
